alert.note: Alert for Butler; Muhlenberg; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 25 at 3:30PM EDT until March 27 at 3:13PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Green River at Rochester affecting Butler, Ohio and Muhlenberg Counties. .Heavy rain from the past 36 hours has caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Green River at Rochester. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Rochester Ferry stops operation. At 37.0 feet, Reeds and Rochester Ferries remain closed. KY 369 floods one mile north of Rochester. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 35.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise near minor flood stage late tonight to a crest around 37 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday morning. - Action stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued by late this evening.
